description: Therapy using anti-tumor necrosis factor monoclonal antibodies to treat inflammatory bowel disease (IBD).
A group of inflammatory conditions of the gastrointestinal tract, primarily including Crohn's disease and ulcerative colitis.
Interleukin 10, a cytokine with anti-inflammatory properties produced by macrophages.
A receptor that binds to the Fc region of immunoglobulins and is involved in immune response mechanisms.
Macrophages that express CD206 and have a regulatory phenotype important for immune regulation.
A subset of T-cells characterized by high expression of CD45Rb, used in models of inflammatory bowel disease.
